==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=肆-financial,亖,皿,龱,𠁤,𠃢,𦉭}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
The original shell and bone character was {{zh-l|*一}} written four times, {{zh-l|*亖}} (compare {{zh-l|*二}} and {{zh-l|*三}}). The bronzeware style of the character featured a repositioning of those four lines inside {{zh-l|*口}}; this later evolved into the combination used today of {{zh-l|*口|mouth}} and {{zh-l|*八|divide}} which meant ''a dispersal of breath''. It could thus be said that [[four]] is a borrowed meaning for this character. The original sense is preserved in {{och-l|呬}}, by adding an extra {{lang|zh|口}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*b-ləj}}.

As superstition, {{ltc-l|四}} is {{w|Numbers in Chinese culture#Four|avoided}} because it is similar to {{ltc-l|死|death}} in sound.
